conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine acceleration from 1 to 3 seconds.
Identify the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds where velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -2 m/s.
At t = 1 second, velocity is 2 m/s; at t = 3 seconds, velocity is -2 m/s.
Calculate change in velocity: Δv = -2 m/s - 2 m/s = -4 m/s.
Determine change in time: Δt = 3 s - 1 s = 2 s.
Calculate acceleration: a = Δv / Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s².
Final answer: The acceleration is -2 m/s².
